node.name: networking in ubunut server
node.rich_text:
ifconfig command - its interface configuration and shows all the connected devices to your system with their ip addresses, netmask, broadcast, packets, and ,mac addresses, hardware - similar to the ipconfig in windows networking - >ifconfig
- Ping command - used to check if a system is connected to the internet or a given device on the given network - if used -c No: shows how many times you want to ping - >ping -c No_of_pings ipaddress eg - >ping -c 3 8.8.8.8
- files that software networking services - they are found in the /etc/hostname for setting the hostname & /etc/network/interfaces for configuring interfaces
>sudo nano /etc/hostname (you can change your hostname here and then reboot your systrem)
- >/etc/network/interfaces - >sudo nano /etc/network/interfaces - Set a static ip for the server in this file - wpa-ssid name (sets your wirelesse network name) - wpa-psk password (sets pasword that wireless network)
- >sudo ifdown interface (disconnects the interface and loose internet connectivity) - >sudo ifup interface (connects back the interface)
- >sudo ifconfig [interface_name] down - >sudo ip link set [interface_name] down
